title: Can you solve the rogue submarine riddle? Difficulty level: Master - Alex Rosenthal

multiple-choice.question: What is the main problem that the protagonist faces in the story?

options.label: A
options.text: Hacking into the nuclear missile launch override

multiple-choice.question: What information did the big boss give to Minion A and Minion B?

options.label: A
options.text: The full information to launch nuclear missiles

options.label: B
options.text: The same two numbers that the agents of chaos used to authorize the launch

options.label: C
options.text: The sum of two distinct positive integers

options.label: D
options.text: The product of two distinct positive integers

multiple-choice.question: What is the condition that A's number must satisfy in order for B to know it?

options.label: A
options.text: The sum of A's number and B's number must be less than 7

options.label: B
options.text: The product of A's number and B's number must be less than 7

options.label: C
options.text: A's number must be a sum of the factors of B's number

options.label: D
options.text: A's number must be a product of the factors of B's number

multiple-choice.question: What are the possible numbers that A's number can be?
What is the condition that B's number must satisfy in order for B to know A's number?

options.label: A
options.text: The sum of B's number and A's number must be less than 7

options.label: B
options.text: The product of B's number and A's number must be less than 7

options.label: C
options.text: B's number must be a sum of the factors of A's number

options.label: D
options.text: B's number must be a product of the factors of A's number

multiple-choice.question: What are the possible numbers that B's number can be if A's number is 5?
What are the possible numbers that B's number can be if A's number is 6?
What are the correct launch codes?
What is the result of the protagonist's actions in the story?

options.label: A
options.text: The missiles are launched and the submarine is destroyed

options.label: B
options.text: The protagonist is captured by the agents of chaos

options.label: C
options.text: The protagonist escapes from the submarine and sends it to the bottom of the ocean

options.label: D
options.text: The protagonist is unable to override the launch and the missiles are launched

multiple-choice.question: What is the main theme of the story?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of teamwork and communication

options.label: B
options.text: The dangers of playing with nuclear missiles

options.label: C
options.text: The power of critical thinking and problem-solving

options.label: D
options.text: The consequences of disobedience and rebellion

title: You could have a secret twin (but not the way you think) - Kayla Mandel Sheets

multiple-choice.question: What is the condition where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body?
What is the source of the second set of genes in individuals with chimerism?
How does chimerism occur in one of the most common forms?

options.label: B
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant

options.label: C
options.text: Through the mother and fetus swapping cells in the flow of nutrients across the placenta

multiple-choice.question: What are the undifferentiated cells that are able to develop into any specialized cell?
Why do fetal cells initially go undetected in the mother's body?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the mother's immune system is not active during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: Because the fetal cells are too small to be detected

options.label: C
options.text: Because the mother's immune system is suppressed during pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Because the fetal cells are not present in the mother's body

multiple-choice.question: What phenomenon is described where a mother's liver starts to regenerate itself, and DNA from a pregnancy almost 20 years earlier is found in the regenerated tissue?
How did Karen Keegan acquire her second genome?

options.label: A
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant

options.label: C
options.text: Through the mother and fetus swapping cells in the flow of nutrients across the placenta

multiple-choice.question: What term describes an individual who has two genomes, one of which belongs to a woman who had never been born?
What percentage of a father's sperm can carry a second genome from an embryonic twin?
What percentage of individual births started out as twin pregnancies?

What is the name of the condition described in the transcript where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body, and one of those genomes belongs to a woman who had never been born?
What is the term used to describe the undifferentiated cells that are able to develop into any specialized cell, which are initially present in the fetus?
Why does chimerism occur in one of the most common forms, through the mother and fetus swapping cells in the flow of nutrients across the placenta?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the mother's immune system is suppressed during pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: Because the mother and fetus are connected through the placenta

options.label: C
options.text: Because the mother's body accepts the fetal cells as its own

options.label: D
options.text: Because the mother's immune system is not active during pregnancy

title: Earth's mysterious red glow, explained - Zoe Pierrat

multiple-choice.question: What was the initial purpose of the satellite in 2009?

options.label: A
options.text: To monitor the health of ecosystems worldwide

options.label: B
options.text: To search for the spectral signature of carbon dioxide

options.label: C
options.text: To track the movement of planets in our solar system

options.label: D
options.text: To study the effects of climate change

multiple-choice.question: What was the unexpected wavelength of unknown origin that researchers noticed?

options.label: A
options.text: A wavelength that corresponds with densely populated areas

options.label: B
options.text: A wavelength that never escapes the Sun's outer atmosphere

options.label: C
options.text: A wavelength that is reflected sunlight

options.label: D
options.text: A wavelength that is emitted by human-made sources

multiple-choice.question: What is the process by which plants use light to grow?
What is the role of chlorophyll pigments in photosynthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: To absorb light and transform it into chemical energy

options.label: B
options.text: To emit light and transform it into heat

options.label: C
options.text: To absorb light and transform it into heat

options.label: D
options.text: To absorb light and transform it into chemical energy, and to emit light as chlorophyll fluorescence

multiple-choice.question: What is the byproduct of photosynthesis?
What happens to excess light absorbed by plants?

options.label: A
options.text: It is stored in the plant's cells

options.label: C
options.text: It is transformed into heat and dissipated out of the plant's leaves

multiple-choice.question: What is chlorophyll fluorescence?

options.label: A
options.text: The process by which plants absorb light and transform it into chemical energy

options.label: B
options.text: The process by which plants emit light at a different wavelength

options.label: C
options.text: The process by which plants absorb light and transform it into heat

options.label: D
options.text: The process by which plants emit light as a byproduct of photosynthesis

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of tracking chlorophyll fluorescence from space?

options.label: A
options.text: It allows us to monitor the health of individual plants

options.label: B
options.text: It allows us to track the movement of planets in our solar system

options.label: C
options.text: It allows us to study the effects of climate change

options.label: D
options.text: It allows us to monitor the health of ecosystems worldwide

multiple-choice.question: What is a direct measure of photosynthetic activity?
What can drops in chlorophyll fluorescence indicate?
